derivation.yuyuan_name: late 17th cent. (in the sense 'resembling a pouch'): from modern Latin marsupialis, via Latin from Greek marsupion 'pouch' (see marsupium)

entry.tran: 有袋动物（如袋鼠或负鼠）
entry.def: A marsupial is an animal such as a kangaroo or an opossum. Female marsupials carry their babies in a pouch on their stomach.

means.word_mean: 1. mammals of which the females have a pouch (the marsupium) containing the teats where the young are fed and carried
1. of or relating to the marsupials;
